gameDescription: In Operation Pollination, players commandeer advanced airships in a near future where the survival of bees and the global ecosystem is at stake. Strategic decision-making meets environmental conservation as you navigate the complex challenges impacting the crucial role bees play in our world.

blueTeam.name: The Bombus Navigators
blueTeam.description: Masters of ecological adaptations and habitat recreation.

redTeam.name: The Apis Aviators
redTeam.description: Experienced in bee proliferation and environmental conservations.

turns.scenario: Your teams are tasked to provide recovery support after a cataclysmic hurricane that devastated bee habitats.

options.A: Plant native flowers in hurricane-affected areas to restore bee habitats.
options.B: Establish new bee colonies in safe zones, ensuring their survival post-disaster.

AA.narrative: Both teams decided to restore the local flora. The reintroduced flowers bloomed, leading to a gradual increase in bee population. Your effort is starting to bear fruit.

AB.narrative: While one team focuses on the local flora restoration, the other team worked on creating safe zones for bees. This comprehensive approach resulted in a faster recovery of the bee livelihoods.

BA.narrative: One team established safe zones while the other planted native flowers. This resulted in a makeshift ecosystem where the bee population could flourish again.

BB.narrative: Both teams decided to establish new bee colonies in safe zones. This approach created a diaspora of bee population that boosted the recovery of the global bee population.

turns.scenario: Forests ravaged by wildfires have displaced many bee populations. Your teams are called to take action.

options.A: Seed fire-ravaged areas with bee-friendly vegetation to encourage ecological recovery.
options.B: Create artificial bee habitats in unaffected regions to support displaced populations.

AA.narrative: Both teams worked on the reseeding project together, creating an influx of new food sources for the bees. However, the rapid change in the environment attracted predators, posing new challenges.

AB.narrative: While one team was busy seeding the fire-ravaged land, the other team was creating an artificial safe space for the bees. This duo strategy works harmoniously resulting in a positive influence on the bee population.

BA.narrative: As one team tackles the introduction of a new ecosystem, the other takes care of the displaced bees. This thoughtful planning makes significant strides in the recovery of the bee population.

BB.narrative: Your team's concentrated effort in establishing artificial habitats resulted in not just effective proliferation of bees but also created a safe space away from natural disasters.

turns.scenario: Having recouped significant losses from the disasters, It's now time to focus on expansion and awareness.

options.A: Develop bee sanctuaries with advanced ecological technology for optimal habitat conditions.
options.B: Launch educational campaigns to promote bee conservation and awareness.

AA.narrative: Both teams decided to focus on advanced bee sanctuaries. While the bee population is at an all-time high due to these efforts, lack of public awareness results in recurring human disturbances.

AB.narrative: While one team develops state-of-the-art sanctuaries, the other team holds awareness campaigns. This all-rounded approach creates a safe space and awareness about it, ensuring negligible human disturbances.

BA.narrative: One team focuses on public engagement and education, while the other works on habitat development. This results in a community-backed conservation effort ensuring long-term habitat safety.

BB.narrative: Both teams invest their resources into public awareness and education. This results in wide-reaching support for bee conservation, paving the path for government involvement and regulations to protect bees.
